metadata.description: Civil Engineering Standard Method of Measurement - Class E measurement rules for earthworks
metadata.australian_context: Applied to Australian civil construction projects with references to AS standards

C1.summary: Items for excavation shall be classified by location and material type
C1.australian_note: Material classification aligns with AS 1289 soil classification standards

C2.summary: Item descriptions for excavation below a body of water
C2.australian_note: Subject to environmental permits and water quality management plans

C3.summary: Items for excavation within confined areas or under live services
C3.australian_note: Dial Before You Dig requirements apply; must identify all services

C4.summary: Items for filling shall be classified by material type and compaction requirements
C4.australian_note: Compaction requirements typically specified to AS 1289.5.1 (Standard) or AS 1289.5.2 (Modified)

C5.summary: Items for landscaping shall be measured separately
C5.australian_note: Native species preferred for erosion control and environmental compliance

M1.summary: Measurement in accordance with CESMM4 paragraph 5
M1.application: General measurement principles for all earthworks

M2.summary: The Commencing Surface shall be identified for all excavation measurement
M2.application: Establishes baseline elevation from which excavation depths are measured
M2.australian_note: Typically referenced to AHD (Australian Height Datum)

M3.summary: Excavation classed by material type (topsoil, other material, rock, artificial hard material)
M3.application: Material classification determines excavation method and productivity rates

M4.summary: Measurement of excavation from borrow pits shall be deemed to include haulage
M4.application: Import of fill material from off-site sources

M5.summary: An item shall be given for disposal where method is otherwise uncertain
M5.application: Separate measurement for disposal when not included in excavation item

M6.application: Volumes measured in m³ to stated depth or thickness

M7.summary: The volume measured for excavation identified in the description
M7.application: Specific volume measurements requiring detailed description

M8.summary: An isolated volume of excavation shall be identified separately
M8.application: Separate measurement for discrete excavation areas

M10.summary: Trimming of excavated surfaces measured in m²
M10.application: Surface preparation after excavation (batters, base slabs)

M11.summary: Preparation of excavated surfaces includes trimming
M11.application: Surface finishing before placing concrete or fill

M12.summary: The volume of disposal of excavated material
M12.application: Separate item for off-site disposal including haulage

M13.summary: Double handling of hazardous materials shall state method
M13.australian_note: Must comply with EPA Victoria/NSW contaminated land regulations

M14.summary: Dredging to remove silt from waterbodies

M15.summary: The area measured for surface treatments
M15.application: Measured in m² for surface-based operations

M16.summary: Filling of excavations shall be measured as placed volume

M17.summary: Where filling to form embankments, material shall be classed as excavated rock only when compaction requirements are specified for the same filling
M17.application: Rock fill classification and compaction specification

M18.summary: Additional filling thickness such as in drainage layers
M18.application: Measurement of granular sub-base and drainage layers

M19.summary: The volume of imported fill shall be stated to stated depth or thickness
M19.application: Imported material from off-site sources with specified depth

M20.summary: Where rock filling is specified: (a) horizontal (b) sloping (c) vertical

M21.summary: Where filling is to be subject to specific compaction requirements

M22.summary: High energy impact compaction measured separately
M22.application: Heavy compaction for structural fills (>95% modified)

M23.summary: Trimming of filled surfaces measured in m²

M24.summary: Preparation of filled surfaces at 45°–90° to the horizontal
M24.application: Batter slope finishing and surface treatment

M25.summary: The area of additional surface treatments

M26.summary: The lengths of hedges measured in linear metres

D1.summary: Excavated material shall be classified by type
material_types: Material other than topsoil, rock, or artificial hard material (general soil/clay/sand)
Stated artificial hard material (concrete, asphalt, masonry)

D2.summary: Excavation in or under water or below services
D2.application: Special excavation conditions requiring additional measures

D3.summary: Excavation from within body of water (dredging)

D4.summary: Controlled and hazardous materials include removal and replacement; excavation for foundations shall be specified

D5.summary: Disposal of excavated material includes off-site haulage

D7.summary: Filling material shall be classified by source and type
fill_types: Excavated other material (general soil from site cuts)
Excavated rock (blasted or broken rock from site)
Imported granular fill (select fill, sand, gravel)

D8.summary: Filling material shall be classed as excavated rock only when compaction requirements are specified for the same filling
D8.application: Rock fill specification and compaction linkage

D9.summary: Filling shall be classed by placement method and compaction

D10.summary: Trimming and preparation of filled surfaces

A1.summary: The location and limits of excavation shall be stated
A1.application: Specify excavation boundaries, depths, and reference levels

A2.summary: Item descriptions for excavation types and special conditions
A2.application: Detail material type, method, and constraints

A3.summary: The location and limits of borrow pits
A3.application: Specify source location and haulage distance for imported fill

A4.summary: The Commencing Surface shall be defined

A5.summary: Item descriptions for excavation materials and conditions
A5.application: Describe soil type, moisture, contamination, etc.

A6.summary: Item descriptions shall state specific details
A6.application: Complete description including all relevant attributes

A8.summary: Item descriptions for disposal and handling
A8.application: Specify disposal method, distance, and environmental compliance

A9.summary: Item descriptions for specific excavation conditions
A9.application: Detail constraints (depth, access, water table, services)

A10.summary: Where material is for reuse or disposal
A10.application: Specify destination (on-site stockpile, off-site disposal, reuse location)

A11.application: Hazardous, contaminated, or special handling materials

A12.summary: The materials shall be specified for filling
A12.application: Detail fill type, source, grading, and compaction requirements

A13.summary: Where different materials or conditions apply
A13.application: Separate items for varying material types or placement conditions

A14.summary: Where the rate of compaction or settlement
A14.application: Specify compaction method, equipment, and acceptance criteria

A15.summary: The materials shall be stated for imported fill
A15.application: Describe imported material specifications and source

A16.summary: Item descriptions for filling types and methods
A16.application: Detail placement method (layers, thickness, moisture control)

A17.summary: Item descriptions for high energy compaction
A17.application: Specify compaction equipment and energy requirements

A18.summary: Item descriptions for filled surface finishing
A18.application: Detail surface treatment (grading, leveling, erosion control)

A19.summary: The type and grade of materials
A19.application: Specify material standards and quality requirements

A20.summary: Where turfing is pegged or specified details
A20.application: Turfing method, species, watering, and establishment

A21.summary: Item descriptions for turfing and landscaping
A21.application: Detail vegetation type, planting density, and maintenance

first_division.australian_context: Underwater excavation for channels, basins, port works

second_division.description: Material other than topsoil, rock or artificial hard material

third_division.description: None typically specified for dredging - bulk volume measurement

first_division.australian_context: Bulk earthworks for roads, building platforms, drainage channels

second_division.description: Material other than topsoil, rock or artificial hard material
second_division.notes: Most common - clay, sand, silt, gravel mixtures

third_division.description: None specified - measured as bulk volume

first_division.australian_context: Footing trenches, pad footings, pier excavations

second_division.description: Material other than topsoil, rock or artificial hard material

first_division.australian_context: Site leveling, bulk cuts not classified as cuttings or foundations

second_division.description: Material other than topsoil, rock or artificial hard material
Stated artificial hard material exposed not exceeding 0.25m
second_division.notes: Thin pavements, surface slabs, thin concrete layers

first_division.australian_context: Surface preparation, trimming, and finishing operations

subdivisions.description: Material other than topsoil, rock or artificial hard material

second_division.notes: Includes compaction, proof rolling, moisture conditioning

first_division.australian_context: Controlled fill placement with specified compaction

second_division.description: To structures (backfill around foundations, retaining walls)
To make up levels (platform fills, site leveling)

compaction_classification.australian_use: Structural fills, building platforms, retaining wall backfill

second_division.notes: Proof rolling, final grading, moisture conditioning

first_division.australian_context: Erosion control, vegetation establishment, environmental compliance

second_division.notes: Grass seed mix, mulching, erosion control matting
Trees, shrubs, groundcovers - native species preferred

third_division.description: None specified - species and planting density stated in descriptions

template_mapping.description: Mapping of Australian civils templates to CESMM4 measurement items

mappings.description: Excavation for cuttings - Material other than topsoil, rock

australian_compliance.environmental: Erosion and sediment control plan required

mappings.description: Filling to make up levels - Imported granular fill - Compacted to 95% Modified

australian_compliance.material_specification: AS 1289.3.6 - CBR testing for select fill

australian_compliance.stockpile_management: EPA erosion control during stockpile period

mappings.measurement_unit: m³ for excavation, m² for trimming

australian_compliance.vibration_monitoring: AS 2187.2 - Vibration limits for nearby structures
australian_compliance.safety: Shot firer license, exclusion zones, blast design documentation

standards_references.AS_1289: Methods of testing soils for engineering purposes
standards_references.AS_1289_5_1: Soil compaction and density tests - Standard compaction
standards_references.AS_1289_5_2: Soil compaction and density tests - Modified compaction
standards_references.AS_1289_3_6: Soil classification and strength tests - CBR
standards_references.AS_2187_2: Explosives - Storage and use - Use of explosives
standards_references.AS_4419: Soils for landscaping and garden use

environmental_compliance.EPA_Victoria: Environment Protection Act - sediment and erosion control
environmental_compliance.waste_tracking: Off-site disposal tracking for volumes >5m³ (urban) or >20m³ (rural)

bulking_factors.note: Applied to cut material for disposal volume calculation

compaction_shrinkage.note: Shrinkage factor - 1m³ loose fill compacts to X m³ in-place

notes: This reference file provides CESMM4 Class E measurement framework adapted for Australian civil construction
All rule texts are abbreviated - consult official CESMM4 standard for complete rule definitions
Australian Standards references (AS) provide local compliance requirements
Bulking and compaction factors are industry benchmarks - verify with geotechnical testing
Template mapping enables automated CESMM4 code assignment during estimate generation
